description: New Latin pedipalpus, from ped-, pēs (“foot”) + palpus (“palpus”).

entries.meaning: (zoology) Either of a second pair of appendages near the mouth of many arachnids, variously specialized as pincers, sensory or locomotory organs.
examples: The defensive movements, on the other hand, involve the whole of the pedipalp being drawn in towards the midline.
